title: Optical Toy, Anamorphosis, French Emperor Napoleon III,  Walter Frères 1865
brief_description: Constellation: The anamorphic drawing presents a distorted perspective of Napoleon III that is corrected when reflected on a circular surface. Napoleon III declared himself emperor of France in 1851, bringing the Second Republic to an end. William Kentridge’s anamorphic animation refers to Italy’s invasion of Ethiopia under Mussolini when 275,00 Ethiopians lost their lives. The title highlights the recurring nature of history.
title_for_label: Optical Toy, Anamorphosis, French Emperor Napoleon III, Walter Frères 1865
description: Anamorphic illusion hide their true subjects in distorted perspectives. When viewed with a viewing cylinder they reveal recognisable images, with some even made to unveil their images when viewed from the right vantage point. Anamorphic drawings helped establish perspective in paintings, photography and special effects, and they also influenced the development of Cinemascope and widescreen in film.
